item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, September 21, 2024 at 12:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ultra high-resolution image of The Night Watch (110 points | 30 comments)
2. Kamal Proxy – A minimal HTTP proxy for zero-downtime deployments (38 points | 17 comments)
3. Visualizing Weather Forecasts Through Landscape Imagery (485 points | 51 comments)
4. The Collapse of Self-Worth in the Digital Age (22 points | 3 comments)
5. Show HN: Container Desktop – Podman Desktop Companion (374 points | 156 comments)
6. Nango (YC W23) is hiring fullstack engs to solve product integrations ( | hide)
7. Critical Exploit in MediaTek Wi-Fi Chipsets: Zero-Click Vulnerability (154 points | 50 comments)
8. Linux/4004: booting Linux on Intel 4004 for fun, art, and no profit (482 points | 118 comments)
9. Show HN: Put this touch sensor on a robot and learn super precise tasks (307 points | 56 comments)
10. CuPy: NumPy and SciPy for GPU (322 points | 94 comments)
11. Open source maintainers underpaid, swamped by security, and going gray (249 points | 228 comments)
12. I Like Makefiles (307 points | 281 comments)
13. How do archivists package things? The battle of the boxes (96 points | 14 comments)
14. Infinite zoom art turned into a game so fun (29 points | 9 comments)
15. Concord had a dev culture of toxic positivity that halted any negative feedback (35 points | 10 comments)
16. Cold war spy satellites and AI detect ancient underground aqueducts (37 points | 4 comments)
17. Porsche's idea for a six-stroke internal combustion engine (77 points | 181 comments)
18. MemoRAG – Enhance RAG with memory-based knowledge discovery for long contexts (149 points | 27 comments)
19. Sshfs for Windows (52 points | 21 comments)
20. Mitosis in the Gray-Scott model: writing shader-based chemical simulations (89 points | 24 comments)
21. Apple Shares Full iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro Repair Manuals (170 points | 98 comments)
22. Reactive Relational Algebra (138 points | 29 comments)
23. Kubesafe: Never run Kubernetes commands on the wrong cluster again (38 points | 19 comments)
24. Inside Annapurna Interactive's Mass Walkout (95 points | 51 comments)
25. Training Language Models to Self-Correct via Reinforcement Learning (214 points | 86 comments)
26. Tō Reo – A Māori Spellchecker (155 points | 30 comments)
27. Show HN: Open-source text classification CLI – train models with no labeled data (60 points | 2 comments)
28. Gaining access to anyones Arc browser without them even visiting a website (1249 points | 425 comments)
29. Openpilot – Operating system for robotics (216 points | 125 comments)
30. Contextual Retrieval (282 points | 69 comments)
